alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cheyenne and northwestern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas through 1000 PM CDT... At 930 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over McDonald, or 17 miles west of Atwood, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Cheyenne and northwestern Rawlins Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Blakeman and Beardsley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of near zero visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility.
